gloss: United States novelist noted for children's books (1832-1888) / United States novelist remembered for his portrayal of life in the United States (1896-1970) / a book written by Sir Thomas More (1516) describing the perfect society on an imaginary island / a long and intricate and complicated grammatical construction / a mental image produced by the imagination / a satirical novel written by Samuel Butler (1872) describing a fictitious land / a suspenseful adventure story or play or movie / a syntactic string of words that forms a part of some larger syntactic unit / a vague idea in which some confidence is placed / an erroneous mental representation / one of the natural units into which linguistic messages can be analyzed / the literary genre of works intended for the theater
creative writing valued for esthetic content
a mental image produced by the imagination / form anew in the imagination; recollect and re-form in the mind / portray in the mind
(of literary or musical or dramatic or artistic work) protected by copyright / a prose narrative shorter than a novel / an extended fictional work in prose; usually in the form of a story

being or occurring in fact or actuality; having verified existence; not illusory; ; ; ; ; ; - Longfellow / lacking in reality or substance or genuineness; not corresponding to acknowledged facts or criteria / not in accordance with the fact or reality or actuality
